title: Riot should steal Overwatchs idea on how to deal with "GG EZ"

replies.body:
Blizzard actually respects their playerbase. Wow.

Fuck this game.

Wow what the fuck blizzard how am I supposed to remind those noobs on the other team how much of  a failure they are and remind myself that I am superior to them because I was on the winning team in a videogame.
Seriously though, if it's just a videogame, then why do people get so worked up about the term "gg ez" in the first place?

Cause even though the action wasn't real, the people behind the screen are.

I think it's just cowardly, if you're gonna trashtalk at all whatsoever, it should be done when the enemy has a chance to prove you wrong, otherwise you're just being a wuss. Personally though, I turn off all chat and go out of my way to type something like "Fun game dudes." if you're nice and say you had fun, then smug nugs will look like the turds they are in comparison.

We have a mute button for that. Only type of toxicity you can't fix with mute is intentional feeding. Seriously get over a couple of messages with some shit talk and get on top of the real toxicity of league. I don't even know how anyone can complain about shit like this anymore with a mute button, just mute and ta da you can't see the words.
Treating the symptom doesn't stop the problem
oh hi dunkey
I think you're misinterpreting what I'm saying. I don't say ggez nor do I condone using the term, but I'm just curious why people get so frustrated over minor trash talk in a videogame.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}} yah know... I don't really care about this discussion, I'm just here for the free corndogs

If you get a win, or kill, then say "GG ez" its basically kicking a man while he's down. You don't want to lose a game you spent 40+ mins playing, and when you do lose, you're probably already annoyed at something that went wrong. And rather than being gracious in victory, these people go out of their way to make it worse. It's completely pointless and yeah, while it is a videogame,  they are still putting other people down to make themselves feel better. These aren't the sort of people I want to know in real life, and they aren't the sort of people I want to be playing with.

Umm, maybe Overwatch's team respects their player base. But look at SC and WoW. Recently I would call it anything but respectful.

Although, my info on SC might be outdated now, so that could be wrong

"You think you do but you don't"

I quit WoW immediately after hearing that, then went on Vanilla private servers and had more fun than I did on live.
Is it any different from Riot's "You think you want this, but our data shows otherwise"?

Yes, its plenty different. Everyone in WoW screamed for it, and with no data or evidence or anything, the devs just said nope. 

Riot on the other hand, has surveys with players (before you complain the format for these surveys makes them biased, there isn't a survey that pleases everyone. Ive seen surveys that people didnt like, then Riot flips to a survey like they asked for, and they complained about that too) These surveys aren't perfect, but theres at least some proof as to why they say things rather than Blizzard's "you think you do, but you don't" 

Also, Riot never says, "you think you want this, but..." They go more along the lines of " Our data shows that 7% of players are the ones who really do not like _Insert whatever here_. Furthermore only about 2% of players are truly negatively affected by _Insert whatever here_. (these are not real numbers, just an example of how they actually say something)

Lies, damned lies and statistics.

The last time Riot used any number, it was to say, _"10% of people are really angry at us for replacing Solo Queue with Dynamic Queue"_.

Then you realize it means, that even 7 million people are very displeased by Riot's actions about a system half the overall community doesn't actually use.
I mean, at least Riot actually has data ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Legends say, somebody somewhere has seen this data at some point.
Bahaha, have you played the last three wow expansions? Not gonna lie, I am a huge Starcraft nerd, but Blizzard can be much much worse than riot.

> [{quoted}](name=Darkslayer85,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FQ1lm9qM,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-08-18T00:30:36.865+0000)
>
> Blizzard actually respects their playerbase. Wow.
> 
> Fuck this game.

HA! Now that's a hoot and a half right there. Thanks for that laugh sir. As a 12 year wow player I needed it
Don't give them too much credit. They only slightly care more than this one.

Who ever came up with that idea, what a fucking god.
http://www.auplod.com/u/poldua8017b.png
It's sad that it doesn't apply to "ez" as well. Would have been even better.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosThief,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FQ1lm9qM,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-08-18T00:37:51.358+0000)
>
> It's sad that it doesn't apply to "ez" as well. Would have been even better.

"I'm wrestling with some insecurity issues in my life but thank you all for playing with me."
It's good enough for me.
http://www.auplod.com/u/poldua8017b.png

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosThief,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FQ1lm9qM,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-08-18T00:37:51.358+0000)

> It's sad that it doesn't apply to "ez" as well. Would have been even better.

> "I'm wrestling with some insecurity issues in my life but thank you all for playing with me."
> It's good enough for me.
> http://www.auplod.com/u/poldua8017b.png

Sounds like a typical {{champion:81}} to me
But then how would we address Ezreal? =P

Let's be real, if I saw one of these filters appear, and then "push mid"

I would get the idea.
"I'm wrestling with some personal issues but thanks for game why the fck did u dive in 1v3 u noob"
Similar mechanic used in Town of Salem where swear words get transformed into random words.

Tarnation!

Dag nabbit!
Is this legit? Thats fkn AWESOME!
We need this but for anything that involves the word bad trash shit cancer downs aids or garbage

> [{quoted}](name=Godwin350037,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FQ1lm9qM,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-08-18T00:19:47.041+0000)
>
> We need this but for anything that involves the word bad trash shit cancer downs aids or garbage

I think filtering these words is not good because people should be aware of them and they should not be used as insults or maybe even casually.

What if I am saying that I have to take out the trash because the garbage smells like shit and because the trash collecting company is being run by an organization that supports people with cancer, downs and aids, so I want to help because those are bad conditions?

> [{quoted}](name=bill84,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FQ1lm9qM,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2016-08-18T00:58:45.618+0000)
>
> What if I am saying that I have to take out the trash because the garbage smells like shit and because the trash collecting company is being run by an organization that supports people with cancer, downs and aids, so I want to help because those are bad conditions?

Maybe pick a better time than in the game to do and say all that :P
thats a reeeeeaaaaalllll big fucking stretch bud........

> [{quoted}](name=Godwin350037,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=FQ1lm9qM,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-08-18T00:19:47.041+0000)
>
> We need this but for anything that involves the word bad trash shit cancer downs aids or garbage

Don't forget:

Autistic, braindead, idiot, fuck, worthless, %%%%bag, hag, shit stain, rimjob, ass face, turd, kys, loser and much, much more.

In Riot's defense, Blizzard made you buy Overwatch. And it's not like you paid anything to play this game *cough $30 ultimate skins cough bs chroma packs cough "free" content that encourages even more spending cough cough*. Ya Riot's just too poor...

And they have so many other projects that require their time, effort, and money. Meanwhile Blizzard only has Overwatch. O wait...

LoL's model is great. Rich people and dumb idiots subsidize the cost so everyone else can play for free.

Same with the crafting system, the people who want to gamble get to, the people who don't still get free shit, and riot makes money that they can use to make more shit. That is the fucking definition of a win win scenario.

Hell doesn't Overwatch actually have bought skins in addition to being a paid game?
No they just have a gamble system I think.

You get a crate with every level up (1 level up takes like 5-6 games)

If you get duplicate stuff in those you get Credits wich you can use to buy most Skins.

There are no Keys in that game :3
How do the Gold weapons work? They seem to be purchasable with a different currency.

Sorry for late reply, Those are Ranked weapons.

You get 1 point for every win in a Competetive match.
Does it actually do that? Because that's absolutely hilarious if it's true.

This is a bad idea in my opinion.
In North America we are already the softest, most easily offended, delicate people on the planet. The more we keep on making it impossible for us to have to actually .. overcome challenges through our _own_ power .. we are gonna up _so_ soft and squishy.
We _don't_ need more "safe spaces".

> In North America we are already the softest, most easily offended, delicate people on the planet.

Do you know germans :D ??
IMO americans are pretty tolerant - I mean, ppl outside of america think of americans as fat ppl that drive their scooter to McDonalds. 
And you guys are ok with that (just by looking at graphs of obese ppl in the last years). Pretty damn tough skin.

________________________________________________________

But I´m with you on the thing about safe spaces.
LoL certainly doesn´t need to get more uptight.

That's cause as Americans we don't care about the rest of the world
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} 
But when we get shit from other Americans......... 
http://i.imgur.com/3X0KnbH.gif

> Pretty damn tough skin.

A common misconception. Americans simply *appear* to have thick skin because of the extra layers of blubber.
This needs to be put into League so bad.

I respect Blizzard for doing this, but honestly "GG EZ", while being very unsportsmanlike, isn't the worst thing people say on video games. I REALLY want a filter for "kys" and all its variants. Insults on the internet don't affect me, but mental illness is on the rise and it should not be acceptable to say "kys".

I don't have a problem with people saying "gg ez" after the nexus is destroyed. What I do have a problem with is people, especially my team, saying "GG" or anything close to "GG" before the nexus is dead. I have been in to many games where people have done this and then they get wiped while fighting by the nexus and then end up losing. If the game was easy why can't you say the game was ez. If it was a good game say good game. Censoring everything someone says is just going to piss off more people than it helps.
